title: Lake Washington School District – Tesla STEM High School High School Lockdowns (2023-2024)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Lake Washington School District – Tesla STEM High School High School Lockdowns (2023-2024)
communications.communication:
Lake Washington School District – Tesla STEM High School High School Lockdowns (2023-2024)

Via email: PublicRecordsrequest@lwsd.org

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1. A complete copy of any and all records and writings regarding any and all school LOCKDOWNS taking place at Tesla STEM High School 4301 - 228th Avenue NE, Redmond 98053.

Responsive records include but are not limited to:

Law Enforcement response and communications
Parent and Student communications and notifications
Incident reports, incident analysis, emails, incident follow up
Media communications, press releases
Court records, witness statements, etc. 
Lockdown response planning, preparation, and training materials

The date range for this public records request is January 1, 2023 – Present (December 19, 2024).

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION PROCESSING AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA) for a public records request is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format, either .pst file or .pdf PORTFOLIO file. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip compression in each installment.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed contemporaneous exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed contemporaneous exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

RAW Computer Aided Dispatch Data queried out of HEART's emergency phone system on 911 calls from January 2021 to the most recent date data is collected. In CSV, TXT, or XML format, a machine-readable spreadsheet (not XLSX format). This data must include whether or not the Alternative Response Program or any iteration of that response team was dispatched and include a unique identifier to be able to match the data to the 911 CAD data from the City of Durham.

Here are the column headers which are requested:

Master Incident Number or Event Number – Unique numerical identifier of the call for service that can be matched to City of Durham 911 CAD data
Case Number – If an incident report was written, this is the file number, which can be joined to the incidents and arrests datasets
Dispatcher ID - A unique identifier for the dispatcher who handled and managed the 911 call
Crisis Call Diversion Staff ID - A unique identifier for the dispatcher who received the call from the 911 dispatcher
Call Date – Date the call for service was generated
Call Time – Time the call for service was generated
Source – How the call was generated from the public or self-initiated by an officer
Priority – The priority level of the call response
Nature – The description of the call for service
Address – The block number and street or intersection of the call for service
Latitude/longitude - coordinates for call of service
X – Mapping coordinate of the call for service
Y – Mapping coordinate of the call for service
District – The patrol district where the call for service was located
Beat – The patrol beat where the call for service was located, which is a sub-division of the district
Tract – The census tract where the incident occurred, based on 2010 census data
Disposition – How the call for service was closed
Cancelled – Whether the call for service was cancelled prior to officer arrival
Who was dispatched - Whether CCD, CRT, COR, police, fire, or EMS
Dispatch Date and Time - The exact date and time when the dispatcher sent the call to emergency responders, such as CRT, COR, police, fire, or EMS
Entry Date and Time - The date and time when the call was initially logged into the 911 computer-aided dispatch (CAD) system
Received Date and Time - The date and time when the 911 call was first answered by the dispatch center
Enroute Date and Time - The date and time when the assigned responder (e.g., a patrol car, ambulance, or fire truck) began traveling to the incident location
On Scene Date and Time - The date and time when the responder arrived at the scene of the incident
Close Date and Time - The date and time when the incident or call was marked as completed or resolved in the CAD system

We also have questions pertaining to the data and HEART: 

-In 911 CAD data from the City of Durham, the "mental health crisis" code does not exist before HEART. What were the relevant codes/terminology in the data that existed before the existence of DCSD or HEART?

-Does the nature code "heart assist" refer to the HEART program or to the body organ?

-Is the nature code "involuntary commitment" specific to the involvement of PD, EMS, fire, CCD, COR, or CRT?

-We are seeing a number of duplicates in the data. These duplicates seem to be generated when the call is received by a CCD staff member and then PD, COR, CRT, fire, or EMS are dispatched. Please see the attached screenshot as an example of such a duplicate. Is the above assumption correct? Also, specific to the screenshot, who exactly was dispatched? EMS, PD, and a back-up unit?

-Is this operational information correct?
The Community Response Team is made up of a mental health Clinician, a Peer Support Specialist, and an EMT.
The Co-Response Team is made up of a mental health clinician with a police officer.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

bocar ba

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

FOIA Request: Comprehensive Records for OSC DI-12192024714
Date: December 19, 2024
To:
Office of the Special Counsel
FOIA Officer
1730 M Street, N.W., Suite 218
Washington, DC 20036-4505
Email: foiarequest@osc.gov
Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request for DI-12192024714

Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (5 U.S.C. § 552), I am formally requesting access to all records, communications, correspondence, and documentation related to the matter identified as DI-12192024714. My request encompasses all materials created, reviewed, transmitted, or received by your office, whether internal or external, in connection with this disclosure. This request is rooted in constitutional, statutory, and public interest protections and seeks full compliance with applicable laws.

Scope of Request
I request the following records:

1. Case Documentation
All materials submitted in the filing or related to the filing of DI-12192024714, including internal reviews, evaluations, and notes.
All emails, letters, memoranda, and other forms of communication referencing DI-12192024714.
Documentation of actions taken in response to DI-12192024714, including decision-making processes, referrals, or outcomes.
2. Investigative Records
All internal and external communications about the handling, investigation, or disposition of DI-12192024714.
Any records indicating OSC staff assignments, meeting notes, or task orders for the investigation.
3. ADA Accommodations and Compliance
Policies, procedures, and guidelines related to ADA accommodations provided to me or considered in processing DI-12192024714.
All communications discussing accommodations for individuals with disabilities in relation to DI-12192024714.
4. Whistleblower Statutory Compliance
Records documenting compliance with whistleblower protections (5 U.S.C. § 1213) in this case.
Any analyses or findings of violations of whistleblower protection laws stemming from the disclosure DI-12192024714.
5. Constitutional and Statutory Compliance
All records evidencing adherence to constitutional protections (First, Fifth, and Fourteenth Amendments) during the handling of this case.
Records reflecting internal discussions about procedural fairness, equal access, and transparency for DI-12192024714.
6. Taxpayer Accountability
Records addressing the allocation of public resources in managing DI-12192024714.
Financial and budgetary documentation related to the administration or handling of DI-12192024714.
7. Correspondence and Contacts
Identification of all personnel, including names, titles, and roles, involved in handling DI-12192024714.
External communications between OSC and other agencies related to DI-12192024714.

ADA Accommodations (Non-Negotiable)
To ensure compliance with Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132) and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act (29 U.S.C. § 794), I require the following accommodations:

Requested ADA Accommodations (Non-Negotiable):
MuckRock Platform Only:
All responses must be delivered exclusively through the MuckRock platform. Portal logins, phone calls, physical mail, or external links are not acceptable.
Accessible Formats:
Embed all response text directly into the email body for accessibility.
Provide PDF attachments formatted for screen-reader compatibility.
Simplified Summaries:
Summarize lengthy or technical records for ease of understanding.
Identification of Responsible Personnel:
Identify all FOIA officers, ADA coordinators, and supervisory personnel involved.
Statutory Justifications:
Provide detailed statutory justifications for all redactions or denials in compliance with 5 U.S.C. § 552(b).

I request a waiver of all fees associated with this FOIA request under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii). This request is made in the public interest, as it seeks to inform public understanding of government operations and is not intended for commercial purposes.

Expedited Processing Request
Pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E), I request expedited processing of this FOIA request due to the urgency of the public interest in this case and the potential consequences of delayed disclosure.

Non-Waiver of Rights
This request does not waive any rights I may have under FOIA, the ADA, or other applicable laws, and I reserve the right to appeal any decision to withhold or redact information.

Response Deadline
FOIA requires a response within 20 business days. Please confirm receipt of this request and provide an expected timeline for fulfillment. Failure to respond within the statutory timeframe will result in further actions, including escalation to oversight bodies and judicial remedies.


Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I trust that your office will handle this request in strict compliance with FOIA, constitutional protections, and statutory obligations.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources

communications.subject: Request for Clarification - AF 2025-01799-F
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Silverman, 
This is to acknowledge receipt of your 19-Dec-24, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request for To Whom It May Concern:Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:The Air Force's report following its review into Elon Musk's security clearance and his compliance with federal reporting protocols, as recently discussed in the New York Times: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/12/17/technology/elon-musk-spacex-national-security-reporting.html 

Unfortunately, I am unable to get behind the paywall when I try to access the article with the link provided.  Can you give me whatever information is included int he article to help identify the referenced report? 

Our office will place your request on hold, pending your response, until 3 January 2025.  If we do not hear back from you by that time, we will administratively close your request.  Please note that without this necessary clarification, our office will be unable to process your request. We have assigned number 2025-01799-F to identify your request; should you need to contact us about your request.  Please direct your questions to SAF.AA.HAF.FOIA.Workflow@us.af.mil and use this assigned number to assist us in responding more promptly. Very Respectfully, HAF FOIA TEAM SAF/AAII (FOIA) Office of the Secretary of the Air Force 1000 Air Force Pentagon Washington, DC 20330-1000

communications.subject: RE: [EXT]:Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Beverage Agreements (Delta College)
communications.communication:
December 19, 2024

Dear Kelly –

Please be advised that Delta College received your electronic FOIA request dated, Thursday, December 19, 2024, on Friday, December 20, in which you requested the following:

“…Agreements related to the beverage pouring rights, distribution, or sales on campus or in athletics venues or facilities. Including any related exclusive marketing agreements for beverage brands in those areas.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.”


Pursuant to MCLA 15.235(2)(d) and 15.235(7), the College is in need of additional time to process your request and hereby issues a notice extending the time to respond to your request by ten (10) business days.  We will respond no later than Tuesday, January 14, 2025.

Arizona Public Records Law Request: Agency Roster
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R099082-121824
communications.communication:
Dear Marcus Boyd, Thank you for your interest in public records of Mesa AZ Police Department Public Records Center. Your request has been received and is being processed.  Your request was received in this office on 12/18/2024 6:26:32 PM and given the reference number R099082-121824 for tracking purposes. Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request.  An invoice will be sent 10 - 15 business days after your request has been received and reviewed. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. While requests are processed in the order they are received, several factors including complexity, volume, and incident type requested will effect completion timeline.  These timeframes are subject to change at any time. Currently processing timeframes are as follows: 
 
  *  New Request Review:  10-15 Business days 
  *  Non-Injury Accidents:  2-4 weeks 
  *  Non-Complex incident report requests:  12-14 weeks 
  *  Complex incident report requests: 18-19 weeks 
  *  911/Non-Emergency Calls:  10-12 months 
  *  Audio/Video Media including Body Worn Camera footage:  28-30 months All other requests:  Timeframe is based upon items requested 
& You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed.  Again, thank you for using the Mesa AZ Police Records. Mesa AZ Police Dept Public Records Center: "My Request Center" 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://mesaazpd.govqa.us/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=99082

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Public Official's/Family Member's Payment Plans
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records related to water and wastewater utility payment plans specifically seeking records that detail the following:

Payment plan records, agreements, and supporting documentation for the following individuals from 2020 to the present--

1. All elected officials (including mayors, trustees, commissioners, and other elected and appointed officials).

2. Immediate family members (including spouses, children, parents and other immediate relatives) of the officials listed above.

For each payment plan, I am requesting the following information:

The recipient’s full name (unless prohibited by law, which I dispute as outlined below).

The address or account location related to the payment plan.

The total payment amount and schedule of payments associated with the payment plan.

The effective date of the payment plan and any records related to its approval.

All correspondence or documentation regarding how eligibility for the payment plan was determined.

I understand that under FOIA (and related state public records laws), agencies may attempt to withhold or redact the names and addresses of individuals under the claim that such information is "personal" or "private." However, I respectfully submit that in this case, such redactions would be inappropriate and contrary to the public interest.

While private citizens generally have a reasonable expectation of privacy, public officials and their immediate family members do not share the same expectation when it comes to receiving public benefits or financial relief.

The information requested (names, addresses, and payment plans) does not expose sensitive private information like Social Security numbers, financial account numbers, or health data. Instead, it reveals details of how public resources are being allocated, which is precisely the type of information public records laws are designed to make accessible.

Public disclosure is essential to allow journalists, watchdog groups, and citizens to identify patterns of favoritism or special treatment for certain individuals or groups.

Names and addresses are already found in public property records, voting rolls, and other public databases. If the recipient’s name and address are already public in other contexts, redacting them here serves no meaningful privacy interest but instead obstructs accountability.

*****If any portion of this request is denied or redacted, I ask that you provide the following:

1. The specific legal exemption(s) being claimed for each redaction or denial.

2. An explanation of how the exemption applies to the specific information being withheld.

3. A list or index of withheld documents, as required under applicable "Vaughn Index" procedures.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daelon

communications.subject: Ref: NPR2024-0070978
communications.communication:
December 19, 2024

Marcus Boyd
177727-55703168@requests.muckrock.com

Re: Nevada Public Records Request NPR2024-0070978

Dear Marcus Boyd,

This correspondence is in response to your Nevada Public Records Act NPR2024-0070978.

You requested:
1. Complaint form
2. Policies/Procedures regarding complaints

In reference to number one (1) of your request, you can locate our employee complaint form online. We have included the link below:

  *   https://www.lvmpd.com/about/transparency/internal-affairs

In reference to number two (2) of your request please see attached as well as below.

  The Public Records Unit forwarded your request to our Policy and Research Group and they determined the request, as worded is too broad. As currently requested, they are unable to confirm what documents are responsive.

Please note, you are seeking any/all records but have not sought a particular record about a particular event, and your request is otherwise overbroad and/or vague. As such, your request is not a request for a sufficiently identifiable record. The Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department (LVMPD) is unable to conduct a simple “Google”-like search of its databases. We must ask that you narrow your request to a specific policy.

The Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department (LVMPD) does not readily maintain any particular record containing the information you are seeking. Moreover, LVMPD databases cannot “readily compile the requested information.” See Public Employees Retirement System of Nevada v. Nevada Policy Research Inst., Inc., --- Nev. ---, 429 P.3d 280, 288 (2018), quoting Las Vegas Metro. Police Dep’t v. Blackjack Bonding, Inc., 131 Nev. 80, 87, 343 P.3d 608, 613 (2015). In other words, your request requires LVMPD to do more than simply “[s]earch[] an electronic database to produce existing records and data….” Public Employees Retirement System at 287, quoting ACLU of Arizona v. Arizona Dep’t of Child Safety, 377 P.3d 339, 346 (Ariz. Ct. App. 2016). Rather, your request requires LVMPD to “compile information about the information [the database] contains.” Id. (emphasis added). As such, your request requires the creation of a new record, which LVMPD has no duty to do under the Nevada Public Records Act. Public Employees Retirement System at 286.

In order to inspect or copy a public record, the specific record must be identified by the person requesting the record. Courts in addressing this issue have held that “agencies are required to disclose only ‘identifiable’ governmental records not otherwise exempt.” Hodai v. City of Tucson & Tucson Police Dep’t, 2014 Ariz. Super. LEXIS 2158, *18 (Ariz. Super. Ct. 2014), quoting MAG Entertainment, LLC v. Division of Alcohol Beverages Control, 868 A.2d 1067, 1076 (N.J. Sup. Ct., App. Div. 2005). “Wholesale requests for general information to be analyzed, collated and compiled by the responding government entity are not encompassed therein.” Id. A governmental agency is not required to respond to an overbroad request that does not request specific records. MAG Entertainment at 1074, citing Capitol Information Association v. Ann Arbor Police, 360 N.W.2d 262, 263 (1985); cf. NAC 239.863(1)(c) (public records request must include a description of the public record that is sufficient to identify the record).

If you obtain any additional information that may assist in our recovery of records you seek, a new request may be submitted. As a courtesy we are providing following policies, that may be responsive to your request.  2.225 Internal Affairs Bureau, 8.330 Maintenance of Values and Ethics & 8.355 Purging of disciplinary files (please see attachments).

Respectfully,

Public Records Unit
Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department
400-A South Martin L. King Boulevard, Las Vegas, Nevada 89106

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show: Any correspondence, including emails, to and from Heather Keil with the words Touhy or 'Food Not Bombs',  from September 1, 2024 through November 1, 2024. Please include emails where Heather is cc'ed or bcc'ed.

Sincerely,

Alexandra Gelzin

title: BRIC Fusion Center Public Outreach presentation

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: BRIC Fusion Center Public Outreach presentation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Slides, PPT presentation, notes and any other records associated with the presentation made by Brian Walsh entitled  "Building Public Legitimacy: Fusion Center Public Outreach Initiatives" on October 22, 2024 at the IACP conference, as noted here: https://iacp2024.eventscribe.net/fsPopup.asp?PresenterId=1921098&mode=presenterinfo

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joshua Dankoff

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Job Application Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Job applicant data for individuals that applied to the Philadelphia Police Department for the position of Police Recruit (or entry-level Police Officer) from January 1, 2016 through present day.

The data should include:

1. Date Applied: MM/DD/YYYY
2. Application ID (unique identifier for application)
3. Gender 
4. Race
5. Military Experience (if applicable—not necessary)
6. Date Hired or Binary if Hired - *only if hired* 
7. ZIP CODE - zip code of the applicant ID (if available—not necessary)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Topper

communications.communication:

All flag submissions submitted to the Illinois Flag Commission.

communications.subject: RE: External: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Illinois Flag Submissions
communications.communication: Thank you for your interest in the Illinois Flag Commission.  The Commission members have selected their Top 10 designs from nearly 5,000 entries. To view the Top 10, visit here https://www.ilsos.gov/special/IFC/10finalists.pdf. Public voting will begin online in January 2025. At that time, the Commission will provide further details on where and how you can cast your vote. Thank you!
